text: Ashland is an American city in the state of Alabama. It is the county seat of Clay County. The city has a population of about 2,000 people. Ashland is the hometown of Alabama's 52nd governor Bob Riley. Supreme Court Justice Hugo Black is from Ashland. ==Geography== Ashland has an area of 7.2 miles. The city is Alabama's highest elevated county seat at 1130 feet. ==References== Category:County seats in Alabama Category:Cities in Alabama Category:1871 establishments in the United States Category:1870s establishments in Alabama
title: Ashland, Alabama
